document_title: What are genital papillomas? Benign or malignant? Causes and symptoms
subsection_name: u-nhu-sinh-duc.json_5_Genital papillomas are often confused with what diseases?
subsection_content:
Genital papilloma is the name of many different diseases, from benign manifestations such as pearly penile papules, hanging mollusks,... to diseases that are dangerous to health such as genital warts, molluscum contagiosum,... Because the external manifestations are quite similar, the group of benign genital papillomas will be confused with the group of papillomas caused by viruses.
Therefore, when detecting abnormal papillomas on the genitals, the patient should immediately go to the hospital so that doctors can diagnose the nature of the genital papillomas and have an effective treatment regimen.
